abstract: The shellacked-looking red mushroom found growing low on tree trunks around the city is called the "mushroom of immortality" in traditional Chinese medicine.
snippet: The shellacked-looking red mushroom found growing low on tree trunks around the city is called the "mushroom of immortality" in traditional Chinese medicine.
lead_paragraph: It's difficult these days to walk around the city without finding fungi growing in planters, on wood mulch, or at the base of trees, so I wasn't surprised to discover a beautiful cluster of red-shellacked reishi mushrooms growing fan-like at the base of a tree at the College of Staten Island.

headline.main: Urban Forager | Reishi, the Leathery Healer
